subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
{{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}} proposes a possible native origin, from ''*k-''nominalized adjective {{och-l|剡}}, which is from {{der|zh|sit-pro|*s-rjam||sharp}} and lost its ''*r-'' initial due to folk etymology; doublets {{och-l|磏|tr=*r(i)am|whetstone}} and {{och-l|鐮|sickle}} retain ''*r-''.

Alternatively, the double-edged sword seemingly originated from the {{w|Nanman|southern}} state of {{w|Wu (state)|Wu}} ({{zh-l|*吳}}); so a native Wu term, of unknown linguistic affiliation, might have yielded both {{cog|och|-}} {{och-l|劍}} and {{cog|mkh-vie-pro|*t-kɨəm}}.

subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
subSections.text:
* [[劍客]] ([[검객]], geomgaek)<!-- (けんかく/けんきゃく) 검사 --> [[swordsman]]
* [[劍工]] ([[검공]], geomgong)<!-- (けん--) 검장 --> sword [[smith]]
* [[劍劇]] ([[검극]], geomgeuk)<!-- (けんげき) 검술극 --> sword [[play]]
* [[劍戟]] ([[검극]], geomgeuk)<!-- (けんげき) 칼과 창, 무기 --> [[sword]]s and [[spear]]s
* [[劍難]] ([[검난]], geomnan)<!-- (けんなん) 칼로 살상당함 --> [[tragedy]] caused by the [[sword]]
* [[劍道]] ([[검도]], geomdo)<!-- (けんどう) 검술 --> [[swordsmanship]]
* [[劍舞]] ([[검무]], geommu)<!-- (けんぶ) 칼춤 --> sword [[dance]]
* [[劍法]] ([[검법]], geombeop)<!-- (けんぽう) 검술 --> [[swordsmanship]]
* [[劍士]] ([[검사]], geomsa)<!-- (けんし) 검객 --> [[swordsman]]
* [[劍術]] ([[검술]], geomsul)<!-- (けんじゅつ) 검도 --> [[swordsmanship]]
* [[劍匠]] ([[검장]], geomjang)<!-- (けん--) 검공 --> sword [[smith]]
* [[劍豪]] ([[검호]], geomho)<!-- (けんごう) 검술의 명인 --> [[swordsman]] [[par excellence]]

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: * Chữ Nôm. The modern Vietnamese word for sword is [[kiếm]].
